column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Nioumachoua
#Text=Nioumachoua is the second-largest town in Moheli .
#Text=In the south of the island , it is the base to explore Moheli Natural Park .
#Text=By bus
#Text=There is a regular bus service from Fomboni .
#Text=Buses start running at 7AM from the market , one way ticket costs FC750 and it takes around two hours .
#Text=Buses departing from Nioumachoua leave at 5AM , it is important to reserve you seat with the driver the day before .
#Text=All buses departing from Nioumachoua have Fomboni as final destination , but they can drive from east or west road .
#Text=The west road is longer than the east road , but it is in much better conditions .
#Text=Travelling from Nioumachoua to Itsamia by bus is tricky .
#Text=The easiest is travelling back to the capital , Fomboni , and then taking a new bus or shared taxi to Itsamia ( shared taxis to Itsamia cost FC500 ) .
#Text=It can happen that no taxi driver wants to drive to Itsamia , as it is far away .
#Text=In this case take a taxi to Wanani or Kangani .
#Text=Wanani is just 12 km to Itsamia , 9 km Kangani-Itsamia , from here try to catch a taxi , hitchhike or just walk .
#Text=Another option is taking the bus back to Fomboni but stopping in Wanani ( 12 km far from Itsamia ) .
#Text=From here you can try to catch a taxi , hitchhike or walk .
#Text=There are not many cars to hitchhike , but the few that are around take passengers easily .
#Text=By shared taxi
#Text=Shared taxis from Fomboni to Nioumachoua run all day long .
#Text=Take in consideration that due to the fuel shortage and the conditions of the road
#Text=finding a taxi to travel between the cities in the south can be difficult and expensive ( up to FC12,500 ) .
#Text=Otherwise in Nioumachoua there are a couple of private cars that for a price will take wherever you wish .
#Text=Take in consideration that the fuel is expensive , so private cars are expensive as well .
#Text=By November 2018 one litre of fuel costs FC1,000 .
#Text=By motorbike
#Text=If you are based in Nioumachoua a very good option is renting a motorbike for yourself .
#Text=Renting a motorbike costs FC7,500 per day .
#Text=By rented car
#Text=Renting a car without driver is very difficult , it cost FC20,000 per day .
#Text=But the real problem is to convince someone to rent you a car , locals do n't trust a lot on tourist 's skills in these roads .
#Text=By boat
#Text=You can travel to other cities in the coast with fisherman boats , every trip may cost more than FC10,000 depending on how far you wan na go .
#Text=Prices might look a bit expensive , but fuel is expensive .
#Text=See
#Text=Whale watching from July to October
#Text=Coral reefs and inhabited isles
#Text=Fishing on the reef with local fishermen
#Text=Livingstone bats ( giant fruit eating bats endemic on Moheli )
#Text=Boating , sailing , canoes and kayaks , bikes
#Text=Hiking in coastal and primary rain forest
#Text=Civets ( small wild leopard type cats )
#Text=Bird Watching ( endemic species ! )
#Text=Traditional villages
#Text=Local artisanat ( carpets from sisal , potteries , embroideries )
#Text=Do
#Text=For every activity at the Natural Park a fee of FC2.500 is required .
#Text=Importantly , the fee permission is paid per person just once as it lasts for three months .
#Text=Humpback whales watching .
#Text=can be done from August to middle November
#Text=Hiring the trip with the local association costs FC35.000 per boat , to share between the tourists in it .
#Text=Laka Lodge charges FC20.000 per person with a minimum of two travellers .
#Text=Snorkeling in coral reefs and inhabited islots .
#Text=You can snorkel pretty much everywhere , although the more isolated the best If you forgot to bring you own snorkeling equipment in Laka lodge
#Text=masks and tubes are rented for FC2.500 .
#Text=Kayaking .
#Text=Take the chance to explore the virgin beaches of Moheli natural park on your own
#Text=Laka lodge rents kayaks for FC5.000 per day .
#Text=Watching Livingston bats .
#Text=, these massive animal are endemic from Comores Islands and famous for being the biggest bats in the world .
#Text=The excursion to watch them includes a 1 hour hike , what is good excuse to learn about local agriculture and medicinal plants from the local guides .
#Text=This is an impossible excursion to be done without a guide , as Livingston bats are not easy to find

#Text=The association from Nioumachoua charges for the transport ( FC7.500 for motorbike with driver , FC12.500 a car with a driver ) and the association from Oualla 1 charges the park fees and guide ( FC2.500 per person ) .
#Text=The same excursion can be hired in Laka Lodge ( FC10.000 per person , minimum 2 people ) .
#Text=Camping in the Natural Park .
#Text=If you have your own tent do n't miss the chance of exploring and sleeping in the of the island , plus if you do n't have snorkelling equipment
#Text=you can rent one in Laka lodge
#Text=The association organises trips , it costs FC20.000 per boat to get drop at one is the islots and picked up the day after .
#Text=Tour in the islots .
#Text=The community bungalows organised trips to discover the whole Natural Park by boat , bring your snorkel equipment
#Text=The association organises trips , it costs FC30.000 per boat to visit all the Natural Park .
#Text=Visiting an islot .
#Text=If visiting all the park sounds extenuating , the other option is sailing to one of the islots , enjoying it for half day and coming back after the association organises the trip
#Text=The association organises trips , it costs FC17.500 per boat .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Des Amis .
#Text=The only local restaurant in town is just in front of the entrance of Laka lodge .
#Text=It can be easily missed as there is no panel or advertisement but an old cartel laying on the floor against the wall .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Community bungalows , Nioumachoua ( At the western point of the beach , next to the last two big baobabs ) , ☏ +2693622633 , +269 4396011 , ✉ adsnmtsangamuhuni@gmail.com .

#Text=These three bungalows where built up in collaboration with the European Community with the pursue of helping the local community to develop a model of tourism , alleviate poverty and promote environmental conservation .
#Text=Bungalows are run by a group volunteers from the village which form a management group that is elected democratically every two years .
#Text=All them are volunteering , only the cooker is an employee .
#Text=Since there is no taxes system anywhere in Comoros the incomes from the communitary bungalows reverts on the village .

#Text=For example , at the school behind the bungalows the orphans from the village get their education granted , the association has built up the library and by November 2018 the hospital was being renovated with the funds from the bungalows .
#Text=Although the bungalows need a bit of restoration , the unbeatable location right on the beachfront and the views from the rooms have no competitors .
#Text=The staff is really friendly and helpful and they organise for you all excursions and trips .
#Text=By November 2018 internet was on process to get installed
#Text=Bungalows cost just FC8,000 per night with breakfast included .
#Text=Meals cost FC2,500 .
#Text=Vanilla lodge , Nioumachoua ( Pay close attention to the location as it is not where booking.com shows on the website .
#Text=The right location is on the road to Oualla , 1km after the path signalled by the panel at the entrance of Nioumachoua ) .
#Text=This lodge is surrounded by nature .
#Text=It offers comfortable , clean and cozy rooms .
#Text=Most of them with views over the rainforest , many others with amazing sea views .
#Text=The restaurant offers very good meals for a very fair price ( FC4,000 per meal ) .
#Text=Good internet connection available
#Text=Rooms from FC12,500 .
#Text=Moheli Laka Lodge , Nioumachoua ( 30 km from the airport ) , ☏ +2697726038 ( land line ) , fax : +421220812027 , ✉ info@lakalodge.com .
#Text=Check-in : 10am , check-out : 2pm .
#Text=Restaurant , " Whale bar " and three beaches , facing the inhabitated coral reef , isles .
#Text=Family and child friendly .

#Text=All hiking and boating services available ( whale watching from July to end of October , fishing , coral reef snorkeling , waterfalls of Meringoni , Livingstone bat reserve , ponding by green sea turtles at night , hiking in coastal and primary forest , canoes , kayaks , bikes , ping-pong , badminton , beach volleyball , etc.
#Text=Ask for Mr. Ally Youssouf , manager 160€ full board .
#Text=Restaurant , mains from 7€ , starters from 4€ .
#Text=Reduction for children under 10 of 5€ per meal .
